contest-event.event-date:
Sept. 3, 1860 D Belle Vue Brass Band Contest
British Open 1 Test Piece Contest
british-open
Set Test and Own Choice
Zampa [unknown arranger]
Belle Vue, Manchester, Greater Manchester, England, UK Zampa plus own-choice test piece
Prizes: 1st: £35 2nd: £15 3rd: £10 4th: £5
I have changed the results. 4barsrest says Heckmondwike were 4th and Deighton were 5th, but a printed list from the contest in 1928 says otherwise (Sharon).
There was a train collision near Helshore, with carriages full of people returning from the contest, which killed 10 and injured 56/
April 12, 2011, 9:36 p.m. Oct. 17, 2015, 3:44 p.m.
1 Halifax Isaac Dewhurst
2 Dewsbury Band John Peel
3 Sherwood Rangers William Lilley
4 Newark British Legion Unknown
5 Heckmondwike Albion John Brook
Unknown Result Deighton Philip Robinson
